member.name: M:PetrolStationManagement.Data.AssignVehicleToPump
member.summary: A method to assign a vehicle to a pump should it be available.
member.remarks:
This method uses logic to assign each vehicle in the 'vehicles' list to the 'last available' pump. This means that instead of simply assigning each vehicle sequentially during the program's lifetime, the app now simulates a real petrol station by operating a queuing system in the forecourt.
This queuing system means that a vehicle using pump #1 would block new vehicles access to pumps #2 and #3 (the same applies for the other lanes) - as per figure #1 in the Assignment Specification.

The number of vehicles which left the forecourt without being serviced is then incremented so the value can be updated on the console UI.

member.name: M:PetrolStationManagement.Vehicle.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A constructor for the Vehicle class.
member.remarks:
This constructor is used to initialise the vehicle members to the appropriate values based upon the type of vehicle. The constructor calculates a quarter of the maximum tank capacity, and when an instance of the Vehicle class is created, the instance is created with a random amount of fuel in the tank which does not exceed this quarter-tank capacity (as per the Assignment Specification).
Cars: A fuel type is randomly selected from a choice of three (LPG, Diesel and Unleaded). The maximum tank capacity is set to 40 litres.
Vans: A fuel type is randomly selected from a choice of two (LPG, and Diesel). The maximum tank capacity is set to 80 litres.
HGVs: Fuel type is set to DieselThe maximum tank capacity is set to 150 litres.
When instantiated, a new timer object is created. If that particular vehicle (/instance of the class) is not serviced in a specific amount of time, that vehicle is removed from the forecourt and from the master Vehicles list. This timer is stopped when the vehicle has been assigned to a pump or if the vehicle is finished being serviced.
member.param: Holds the current type of a vehicle.
